page.title: 15THE RAILWAY TODAY SWANAGE
page.content: In 1980 the railway made it's first run from Swanage to Herston (one mile away). This was done after much work by volunteers who gave up a lot of their spare time. As the line is extended new halts will be built en route to Wareham so that as many people as possible can benifit, as early as possible, from the restored rail service. At the present time the trains are pulled by industrial tank engines. Some of the coaches are historical Southern and British Railway coaches, including a Pullman. As it takes a few hours for a steam engine to get up steam, a diesel engine can be used to save time. This diesel will also be used regularly when the track is eventually extended to Wareham.
